content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Laboratory (Attempted) at Position(x=0.5, y=2.5)
Intended to serve as the central research facility for supplying Automation Science Packs. Repeated attempts to craft and place a Lab have failed because the required Lab item was not present in the inventory and the necessary sub‐ingredients were unavailable.

### Iron Smelting Furnace (Utilized) at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0)
A pre‐existing furnace used to convert iron ore (with coal support) into additional iron plates. Its output is critical for meeting the sub-ingredient requirements in subsequent crafting, even though it was not newly constructed by the agent.

### Copper Smelting Furnace (Utilized) at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0)
A pre‐existing copper furnace employed to process copper ore into copper plates. These copper plates support the production chain for copper cables and related intermediate components. No new smelting structure has been built by the agent.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• API Usage Issues with get_entities:
 – Avoid mixing keyword and positional arguments. In one instance the use of a ‘radius’ keyword caused an unexpected argument error, and in another the function was supplied with positional arguments despite not accepting any. Verify the correct function signature before invocation.

• Lab Placement and Iteration Errors:
 – Ensure that the required Lab item is present in the inventory prior to attempting placement.
 – Validate that get_entities returns a proper iterable (and not None) before performing operations such as filtering.

• Lab Crafting Resource Shortages:
 – Confirm that all sub-ingredients in the Lab’s crafting chain (for example, iron-gear-wheels, electronic circuits, copper cables, and the associated raw materials) are sufficiently available.
 – Monitor and update resource inventory levels and ensure that smelting or processing steps yield the necessary outputs to satisfy higher-tier recipes.
 – Review the crafting dependencies to prevent recurring shortages that block Lab production.
